instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.U7501: What is U7501? This chip is often responsible for creating PP3V3_S5,  PP3V3_S3,  PP3V3_S0,  PP5V_S5,  PP5V_S4,  PP5V_S0.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7122: What is R7122? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.PPVCC_S0_CPU: What is PPVCC_S0_CPU? The "PPVCC_S0_CPU" power rail is responsible for supplying power to the CPU when the MacBook is fully on, or in the S0 state. This rail is one of the main voltages that the CPU requires for operation. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PLT_RESET_L: What is PLT_RESET_L? PLT_RESET_L is platform reset, this signal keeps the system from POSTing. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes quarter fan spin
threads.message:
dont see any water damaged, but anyway i cleaned it properly

first it did not have any voltages, not even 3.4V, after taking it apart and just testing it on the table now it has green light, 3.4V, 8.59V, 3.3V

most of the time fan wont spin, but sometimes it goes in a loop, fan spins a bit, stops, spins a bit  and so on

replaced: <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>

<RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR> <RESISTOR>R7122</RESISTOR> are ok, 10 ohm, connecting to the chip

<CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR> have 3.3v on pin1

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes quarter fan spin
threads.message:
"replaced: <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>, <CHIP>U7501</CHIP>"
What measurments made you changed them?

Any pulse at <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> and VCORE?
Did you try SMC bypass mode?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes quarter fan spin
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>PPVCC_S0_CPU</SIGNAL> jumps up to 1.8v, and a second later again, then nothing, on L7320 i measure 16ohm without removing the coil

 <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL>   jumps to3.3V, then 3 seconds later again, then dies

in smc bypass mode at least the fan spins twice, but the measured voltages are the same

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes quarter fan spin
threads.message: <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>   does the same, 3.3V volt, jumos up twice then dies

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes quarter fan spin
threads.message: Check for pulse at pin 3 of <CHIP>U1950</CHIP> and <SIGNAL>PLT_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes quarter fan spin
threads.message:
they are doing the same as well

jump to 3.3 twice then zero

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes quarter fan spin
threads.message: Check all SPI Bus Series Termination resistors and their traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes quarter fan spin
threads.message:
all the resistor ar ok, traces are not damaged, no water damage at all

i put a new bios chip on it from another 00165 board, as far is a know at least it should power on with other bios chip, but this does the same thing, voltages come up 2x then dies

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sometimes quarter fan spin
threads.message:
So you get two pulses when charger is connected?
Low chances to solve it.
Change SMC, just in case.
